Token.Abstract: Provides convenience methods for accessing data in resources within an NSBundle.
Returns the MIME Type for the resource identified by the specified name and file extension.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the resource file.

Parameter.Name: extension
Parameter.Abstract: If extension is an empty string or nil, the extension is assumed not to exist and the file is the first file encountered that exactly matches name.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The MIME Type for the resource file or nil if the file could not be located.

Token.Abstract: Creates and returns a data object by reading every byte from the resource identified by the specified name and file extension.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the resource file.

Parameter.Name: extension
Parameter.Abstract: If extension is an empty string or nil, the extension is assumed not to exist and the file is the first file encountered that exactly matches name.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A data object by reading every byte from the resource file.

Token.Abstract: Creates and returns a string object by reading data from the resource identified by the specified name and file extension using a given encoding.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the resource file.

Parameter.Name: extension
Parameter.Abstract: If extension is an empty string or nil, the extension is assumed not to exist and the file is the first file encountered that exactly matches name.

Parameter.Name: encoding
Parameter.Abstract: The encoding of the resource file.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A string created by reading data from the resource file using the encoding.

Token.Abstract: Creates and returns an object representation of the data from the resource identified by the specified name and file extension by reading the data as a string and parsing it using a parser appropriate for the MIME Type of the file.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the resource file.

Parameter.Name: extension
Parameter.Abstract: If extension is an empty string or nil, the extension is assumed not to exist and the file is the first file encountered that exactly matches name.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new image object for the specified file, or nil if the method could not initialize the image from the specified file.
